Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
Contains all the data connected to the player on the client side.
Author:
Matteo Negro

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, WizardType wizardType, int coins, com.google.gson.JsonObject schoolBoard, com.google.gson.JsonArray hand, com.google.gson.JsonObject playedAssistant)
      Class constructor used to restore the game.
      Parameters:
      name - Player's name.
      wizardType - Player's Wizard.
      coins - Player's coins.
      schoolBoard - Player's SchoolBoard.
      hand - Player's deck of Assistants.
      playedAssistant - The list of played Assistants.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the Player.
      Returns:
      Name of the Player.

    • getWizard

      public WizardType getWizard()
      Gets the Player's Wizard.
      Returns:
      Player's Wizard.

    • getCoins

      public int getCoins()
      Gets the number of coins the Player has.
      Returns:
      Number of coins the Player has.

    • addCoins

      public void addCoins()
      Adds one coin to preview coin amount.

    • takeCoins

      private void takeCoins(int number) throws NegativeException, NotEnoughCoinsException
      Removes the specified number of coins. Used in combination with paySpecialCharacter.
      Parameters:
      number - Number of coins to spend.
      Throws:
      NegativeException - If the number of towers is negative.
      NotEnoughCoinsException - If the number of available coins is less than the required one.

    • getSchoolBoard

      public SchoolBoard getSchoolBoard()
      Gets the Player's SchoolBoard.
      Returns:
      Player's SchoolBoard.

    • getHand

      public List<Assistant> getHand()
      Gets the list of available assistants in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      List of available assistants.

    • getAssistantById

      public Assistant getAssistantById(int id)
      Gets an assistant by its identification number.
      Parameters:
      id - The assistant id.
      Returns:
      The assistant if it is found, null otherwise.

    • getCurrentPlayedAssistant

      public Assistant getCurrentPlayedAssistant()
      Gets the assistant that was played in the current turn.
      Returns:
      The played assistant.

    • cleanCurrentPlayedAssitant

      public void cleanCurrentPlayedAssitant()
      Cleans at the end of the turn the assistant that was played in the current turn.

    • playAssistant

      public Assistant playAssistant(int id) throws AlreadyPlayedException
      Plays the selected Assistant, giving back a reference to it.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the Assistant to be played.
      Returns:
      Chosen Assistant, if available.
      Throws:
      AlreadyPlayedException - If the Assistant had already been played.

    • paySpecialCharacter

      public void paySpecialCharacter(SpecialCharacter specialCharacter) throws NotEnoughCoinsException, NullPointerException
      Plays the specified SpecialCharacter.
      Parameters:
      specialCharacter - Selected SpecialCharacter.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughCoinsException - If the number of available coins is less than the required one.
      NullPointerException - If the argument is null.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns the state of the player, true whether it's the current player.
      Returns:
      The active attribute.

    • setActive

      public void setActive(boolean active)
      Sets the second of active.
      Parameters:
      active - True whether the player is the current player.

    • parseHand

      private void parseHand(com.google.gson.JsonArray hand)
      This method instantiates and initializes the assistants in the player's hand through the info contained into the given JsonArray.
      Parameters:
      hand - The JsonArray containing the hand info.

    • parseSchoolBoard

      private void parseSchoolBoard(com.google.gson.JsonObject schoolBoard)
      This method instantiates and initializes the player's school board through the info contained into the given JsonObject.
      Parameters:
      schoolBoard - The JsonObject containing the school board info.
